DataElement.preferredName: Symptom Distress Scale Nausea 2 Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Person's stated observation of the degree of distress they experience related to their nausea, using a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A patient reported questionnaire composed of rating scales developed to measure the degree of distress experienced by the patient for specific symptoms._A question about how nausea effects an individual._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A patient reported questionnaire composed of rating scales developed to measure the degree of distress experienced by the patient for specific symptoms.

Concepts.definition: A patient reported questionnaire composed of rating scales developed to measure the degree of distress experienced by the patient for specific symptoms.

Property.preferredDefinition: A question about how nausea effects an individual.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A question about how nausea effects an individual.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredName: Symptom Distress Scale Nausea 2 Score 5 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric scores from 1 (When I do have nausea, it is very mild) to 5 (When I have nausea, I am as sick as I could possibly be) on a Likert scale used on the Symptom Distress Scale questionnaire.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: When I have nausea, I am as sick as I could possibly be

ValueMeaning.preferredName: When I have nausea, I am as sick as I could possibly be
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that when an individual has or had nausea, they were as sick as they could possibly be.

Concepts.longName: Have Nausea Am as Sick as I Could Possibly Be
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that when an individual has or had nausea, they were as sick as they could possibly be.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: When I have nausea, I usually feel very sick

ValueMeaning.preferredName: When I have nausea, I usually feel very sick
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that when an individual has or had nausea, they usually felt very sick.

Concepts.longName: Have Nausea Usually Feel Very Sick
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that when an individual has or had nausea, they usually felt very sick.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: When I have nausea, I feel pretty sick

ValueMeaning.preferredName: When I have nausea, I feel pretty sick
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that when an individual has or had nausea, they felt pretty sick.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that when an individual has or had nausea, they felt pretty sick.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: When I do have nausea, it is mildly distressing

ValueMeaning.preferredName: When I do have nausea, it is mildly distressing
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that when an individual has or had nausea, it was mildly distressing.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that when an individual has or had nausea, it was mildly distressing.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: When I do have nausea, it is very mild

ValueMeaning.preferredName: When I do have nausea, it is very mild
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that when an individual has or had nausea, it was very mild.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that when an individual has or had nausea, it was very mild.

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure.  The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents.  Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.

ReferenceDocuments.name: SDS User's Manual
ReferenceDocuments.description: Documentation of the development, method of administration,  scoring procedures and psychometric properties of the SDS.
